headline: Warren Buffett-led Berkshire Hathaway Owns 400 Million Shares of This Recession-Proof Dividend Stock: Could It Make You a Millionaire?
summary: This single position generates over $800 million in annual income for Berkshire Hathaway.  Demand for this company remains resilient in difficult economic conditions, something investors might appreciate today.  Investors pay close attention to the companies here, as they could present potential buying opportunities.

headline: 47.7% of Warren Buffett's $282 Billion Portfolio Is Invested in 3 Stocks That Could Net Berkshire Hathaway $1.6 Billion in Dividends This Year
summary: Buffett likes investing in companies that return money to shareholders through dividends, because they compound his returns more quickly.  Three of Berkshire's holdings, which represent almost half of the value of its portfolio, could deliver $1.6 billion in dividend payments this year.  Warren Buffett has been the CEO of the Berkshire Hathaway holding company since 1965.
